Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a plant with water and show it looking healthy and growing.
The student can draw a plant without water and show it looking unhealthy or wilting.
The student can draw patterns in plants that illustrate what happens to them when they receive light and water versus when they do not, but might occasionally lack some details.
The student can use their drawings to generally demonstrate that plants need water and light to live and grow, though some details might be implicit.
CANNOT: The student might occasionally omit elements like the sun or raindrops, leading to a less complete demonstration of why the plant is healthy or unhealthy (e.g., only showing water but not light).

The student could mix up representations, such as drawing irregular patterns for wilting leaves but not clearly connecting it to the lack of water (e.g., *(student does not always show why leaves wilt)*).
